thread.title: PIAA to expand classifications in high school football and other sports
thread.title_full: PIAA to expand classifications in high school football and other sports

title: PIAA to expand classifications in high school football and other sports
text:
DON'T TOUCH! Doctors warn about dangerous caterpillar 
Members of the PIAA board of directors gathered Wednesday and made a groundbreaking decision to expand classifications in football from four to six. 
The vote was an easy pass for the board, which voted 26-4 in favor of the expansion. The four no votes came from Western Pennsylvania’s WPIAL and City League. 
Football expand to six classifications, along with baseball, boysand girls basketball and softball. 
According to Channel 11’s news partners at TribLive, teams will learn their new classifications in mid-November and will have until Dec. 15 to decide to "play up" in class. Sign up for our WPXI-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
